page.title: 18Kilgetty Railway halt.
page.content: This used to be a station and the old Co-op building stood nearby and used the station for receiving farming materials. Farmers brought sugar beet and other crops to be loaded. 2 years ago Clifford Jenkins managed a Farming Co-op nearby but Clynderwen Co-op became more powerful and no Farming Co-op remains. Trains run from Pembroke Dock through Tenby to Whitland where they join the main line to London. Only very few passengers use Kilgetty Halt. Verity's brother sometimes comes home from Greenhill Secondary School, Tenby and gets off at the halt. A new bridge had to be built to take the railway over the by pass. It was put up in one evening by very large cranes.
